thread.title: Wizz Air hails record first quarter
thread.title_full: Wizz Air hails record first quarter

title: Wizz Air hails record first quarter
text:
Save 
Low-cost airline Wizz Air has raised its profit forecast for the year by as much as €20 million as it looks set to benefit from increased demand over the peak summer period. 
The Hungary-based carrier reported a record first quarter underlying net profit of €33.9 million, an increase of 14.7%. Total revenues were up by 21% to €1.2 billion. 
The record performance came despite Easter falling one week earlier than in prior year and prompted the company to increase its full-year guidance to be in the range of €175 million and €185 million, up from between €165 million and €175 million. 
József Váradi, Wizz Air chief executive said: “The first quarter has been an exciting period for Wizz Air. 
“We have continued to grow our network and increase our passenger numbers throughout the period while maintaining an industry leading, ultra-low cost base. 
“Today we are pleased to announce a record set of results for the first quarter with a strong performance against all key operating and financial performance measures.”
